body.name: OSHA Compliant First Aid Kit - 10 Person, Type III, ANSI Class A Emergency Kit for Truck, Car, Construction Site - 71 Essential First Aid Supplies
body.couponInfo: Save an extra $2 on your first Subscribe and Save order.
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Thursday, February 22 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
features: This essential emergency kit comes packaged in a compact plastic case, making it the ideal first aid kit for a wall mount, or to keep in a vehicle glove compartment.
The 10 person first aid kit is OSHA compliant, meets ANSI standards and is Type 3, class A. Designed for business, commercial, contractor, and home use.
This comprehensive kit contains 71 essential first aid supplies, from a wide assortment of gauzes and bandages to burn cream, CPR kit, gloves, cold packs and more!

The first aid kit comes in a durable plastic case with two latches and a comfortable handle with quick and easy emergency access. The case also includes wall mounting tabs for use as a wall mounted first aid kit or on either horizontal or vertical surfaces.
This OSHA approved first aid kit includes a manual and guide, and can be used indoors and outdoors.
This small medical emergency first aid kit is ideal as a travel first aid and safety kit.

Kit Contains (See product description for complete detailed list): Abdominal Wound Combine Pad, Sterile 5x9, Adhesive Bandages, Sheer Plastic 1x3, Burn Cream with Lidocaine .9g, Burn Dressing Pad 4x4, BZK Antiseptic Cleansing Towelette, Eye Pad, Sterile 1-5/8 x 2-5/8, First Aid Booklet, First Aid Scissors, Gauze Pads, Sterile 3x3, Hand Sanitizer .9g, Instant Cold Pack (disposable)

Contents (continued): Irrigate Eye Wash 1 oz, Mask CPR Protector in plastic bag, Pair of Nitrile Gloves, Sterile Conforming Gauze Roll Bandage, Triangular, Bandage 40x40x56, Triple Antibiotic Ointment .9g Packet, Waterproof Adhesive Tape .5 inch.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent First Aid Kit
reviews.reviewText: This is a great first-aid kit for any house or car. It comes with a plastic case to hold all the first aid items. This box has holes where it can be attached to a wall but I am using it in my car. You never know when you need first aid items, especially with small children. The set is pretty extensive. It says it is for 10 people. I'm not sure how they come to that number but this set does come with lots of items. Tons of different-sized bandaids, gauze, wrap strips, gloves, q tips, antibiotic cream, burn cream, eye wash, a CPR pamphlet, you name it. It is very nice. I like to keep it in my car since I have children who seem to always need a bandaid.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Does the job
reviews.reviewText: This is a no frills first aid kit. Has most things you’d need and expect to find. I wouldn’t say the items in it are super high quality but they would get the job done. If you need an inexpensive OSHA complaint kit then this would be a good choice.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great First Aid kit for the car
reviews.reviewText: This OSHA Compliant First Aid Kit comes in a plastic container to keep everything in one place. I previously just had a zipper bag with various stuff in it in case of emergencies...this is much better than what I'm used to. The kit comes with Abdominal Wound Combine Pad, Adhesive Bandages, Burn Cream, Tongue Blads, Guaze Pads, Waterproof Adhesive Tape, Cotton Tip Applicators, Finger Bandages, Butterfly Bandages, Antiseptic Cleansing Towelettes, Sheer Bandages, Guaze Sponges, Forceps, Alcohol Prep Pads, Triple Antiboiotic Cream, Irrigate Eye Wash, Gloves, Conforming Gauze Roll...most of the stuff are separated into mini zipper bags. It has an expiration date of listed on the container of Oct 2025. This will be very handy to have when traveling. Granted it doesn't have everything but it should be sufficient as a safeguard.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars ⛑️🚑🏥 First Aid Kit ⛑️🚑🏥 10 Person ⛑️🚑🏥 Plastic Case ⛑️🚑🏥 92 Piece Kit ⛑️🚑🏥
reviews.reviewText: There is so much medical stuff in this first aid kit that it’s quite amazing it could all fit comfortably in this carrying case. For a list of all the first aid items, look at the listing description for details. I am quite impressed with the amount of items here. I like that there are different sized bandages and burn cream. Having nitrile exam gloves 🧤 is good because some people have latex allergies. But, why only 2 gloves? That’s only enough for one person to wear on their right and left hands. I would put more gloves in this kit because you don’t want cross contamination and gloves can tear easily. The plastic carrying case is white and very visible. The handle is flimsy though, and probably won’t last long if it is being used. Long story short, this is a decent first aid kit. Personally, I would add a few more things to it, but it’s a pretty good first aid kit and gets the job done. 👍🚑🩷😃⛑️😜🏥💜😝⛑️😆🚑💙😎⛑️😝🚑💚🤔🏥🤪⛑️😃❤️🚑😊⛑️💜😜🏥💙🚑🤪⛑️

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars A Well-Stocked Kit
reviews.reviewText: I ordered this first aid kit to replace the one I bought many years ago and which I'm sure contains things that are mostly expired. I was not disappointed in the assortment of first aid items contained in this small package. It has pretty much any bandage you could ever need as well as plastic gloves, antiseptic, and gauze. With kids around, you never know what you are going to need, so I will definitely take this with us on car trips and keep it handy at home the rest of the time. The only thing lacking from this kit is any sort of medicine, such as pain or stomach relief. Otherwise it is very full.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Lots in a compact box [ProHeal 10 Person First Aid Kit with Plastic Case - 92 Piece Kit]
reviews.reviewText: ProHeal's 10 Person First Aid Kit has a lot packed into the box. Almost all the products are from the E+R company (Ever Ready First Aid brand), with clear labeling and earliest expiration occurring in 10/2025. Beyond the basic expected bandages, burn cream and antiseptic wipes, I was happy to see included eye wash as well as thumb forceps (would definitely be useful for my family). The box doesn't have the most professional labeling, but I do like that it has a rubber gasket to keep things dry and it has built in holes to allow it to be mounted to a wall. It does not contain oral medications, but it is good for many minor emergencies.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Comprehensive First Aid on the Go, Nice Little Portable First Aid Kit
reviews.reviewText: This first aid kit with a convenient carrying case is a must-have for anyone on the move. It's impressively self-contained, providing all the basic necessities essential to keep on hand for emergencies. Ideal for use in various settings, including cars, boats, or during camping trips, it ensures you're well-prepared for unexpected situations. The added convenience of being wall-mountable makes it equally suitable for home use. Designed to cater to the needs of up to 10 people, this portable first aid kit combines versatility with practicality, making it an essential companion for safety-conscious individuals in diverse environments.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Solid collection of essentials
reviews.reviewText: This first aid kit contains all the major essentials neatly packed into a small container. The plastic container has a rubber seal so at the very least it is watertight. The contents are in individual baggies which is a nice feature. There is a generous amount of each item. The contents were all sealed and well within their expiration date.What could be improved: The front and back labels feel like they were done with an inkjet printer. Slightly nicer outer packaging would elevate this a bit. That being said, I would still say this is a 5-star first aid kit because the outer label in no way effects the functionality.
